results.definition: exchange or replace with another, usually of the same kind or category
the act of changing one thing for another thing
examples: Adam was promised immortality in exchange for his disobedience

results.definition: give to, and receive from, one another
put in the place of another; switch seemingly equivalent items
reciprocal transfer of equivalent sums of money (especially the currencies of different countries)
exchange a penalty for a less severe one
a workplace that serves as a telecommunications facility where lines from telephones can be connected together to permit communication
the act of putting one thing or person in the place of another:
(sports) an unbroken sequence of several successive strokes
change over, change around, as to a new order or sequence
a mutual expression of views (especially an unpleasant one)
a workplace for buying and selling; open only to members
chemical process in which one atom or ion or group changes places with another
(chess) gaining (or losing) a rook in return for a knight or bishop
(chess) the capture by both players (usually on consecutive moves) of pieces of equal value
examples: the endgame began after the exchange of queens

results.definition: hand over one and receive another, approximately equivalent
examples: exchange employees between branches of the company

results.definition: the act of giving something in return for something received
examples: deductible losses on sales or exchanges of property are allowable
